topic_or_construct: Frequency of functions of future thinking
justification: "The aim of this study was to develop and psychometrically validate a self-report tool to measure the frequency of future thinking for various functions, henceforth referred as the Functions of Future Thinking Scale (FoFTS)."

measured_by: Hallford (2019) general future thinking frequency items
justification: "Items to assess how frequently individuals thought about their future generally, at different time distances, were taken from Hallford (2019)… the items relating to the 'short-term future'… and items relating to the 'long-term future' were averaged together to form two subscales."

measured_by: Zimbardo Time Perspective Scale – Future Negative subscale
justification: "Three-item versions of the future negative and future positive subscales from the self-report ZTPS were used to assess how negative or positively-valenced people judged their future thinking as being."

measured_by: Zimbardo Time Perspective Scale – Future Positive subscale
justification: "Three-item versions of the future negative and future positive subscales from the self-report ZTPS were used to assess how negative or positively-valenced people judged their future thinking as being."

topic_or_construct: Clarity of thoughts about future self
justification: "The clarity subscale of the FSQ was used to assess the clarity with which people have thoughts about themselves in the future."

"The TALE is a self-report 15-item measure of how frequently people use their autobiographical memory for specific functions. Five items are used to assess each of three functions: self, directive-behavioural, and social bonding."
"Life Orientation Test (LOT-R; Carver & Scheier, 2003). The LOT-R was used to assess optimism, as defined by the tendency to hold positive generalized outcome expectancies."
"New General Self-Efficacy Scale (NGSE; Chen, Gully, & Eden, 2001). NGSE was used to assess self-efficacy."

measured_by: Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ) – 3-item short form
justification: "A three-item short form of the PSWQ was used to assess the tendency to worry."

measured_by: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) – Positive Affect subscale
justification: "The self-report, five-item positive affect subscale from the PANAS was used to assess positive affect."
"To determine probable major depression, a cutoff of 11 points or higher on the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 item version (PHQ-9; Kroenke et al., 2010) was used."
